api_db_test_auth_failed: Authentication failed. Please check your username and password.
api_db_test_conn_unauthorized: Connection successful, but not authorized. Please provide user credentials with permissions to proceed.
setup_database_intro: Enter your database connection details. SveltyCMS supports MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and MySQL databases.
setup_db_postgres_mysql_note: Support for PostgreSQL and MySQL is in active development and will be available in a future release.
setup_db_postgres_mysql_timeline: Until then, please use MongoDB (standard or Atlas). If you need PostgreSQL/MySQL support urgently, please let us know on GitHub Discussions - we prioritize features based on community feedback.
setup_email_aria_switch_standard: Switch back to standard SMTP ports
setup_email_feature_2fa: Two-Factor Authentication: Security codes via email
setup_email_feature_notifications: System Notifications: Error reports, backup confirmations
setup_email_feature_password: Password Recovery: Reset tokens and recovery emails
setup_email_feature_user_mgmt: User Management: Welcome emails, account verification
setup_email_feature_workflow: Content Workflow: Approval notifications, content updates
setup_email_from_note: If empty, will use SMTP username as sender
setup_email_help_host: Enter your SMTP server address (e.g., smtp.gmail.com). This server will be used to send all system emails.
setup_email_help_password: Your SMTP password. For security, we recommend using an App-specific password if your provider supports it.
setup_email_help_port: Common ports are 587 (TLS/STARTTLS) and 465 (SSL). Port 25 is legacy and often blocked by providers.
setup_email_help_provider: Select your email service provider to auto-configure SMTP settings, or choose Custom to enter your own.
setup_email_help_user: Your SMTP username, usually your full email address (e.g., mail@example.com).
setup_email_preset_note_gmail: Use App Password, not your regular password
setup_email_skip_note: Note: You can skip this step and configure SMTP later in System Settings.
setup_email_test_email_sent: Test email sent to {email}. Please check your inbox.
setup_email_test_required: Please test the SMTP connection before proceeding
setup_email_test_success_desc: Your SMTP connection is working correctly. A test email has been sent to your admin email address.
setup_email_why_desc: SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is required for the following features:
setup_heading_subtitle: Configure your {siteName} in a few simple steps
setup_help_admin_confirm_password: Re-enter the password to confirm there are no typos. Must match exactly.
setup_help_admin_email: Used for password recovery and system notifications. Must be valid.
setup_help_admin_password: Choose a strong password. Minimum 8 chars including letters, numbers & special characters. Do not reuse old passwords.
setup_help_admin_password_requirements_a: This account will have full administrative privileges
setup_help_admin_password_requirements_l: At least one letter (A-Z or a-z)
setup_help_admin_username: Unique login name for the administrator account. Can be changed later.
setup_help_content_languages: Languages available for authoring content. Can include experimental or partially translated locales.
setup_help_database_host: Hostname or IP address where the database server is reachable.
setup_help_database_name: Name of the database/schema to use or create.
setup_help_database_password: Password for the database user. Store securely; not shown in logs.
setup_help_database_port: Network port the database server listens on. Defaults vary by engine.
setup_help_database_type: Select the database engine to use. Ensure the server & driver are installed.
setup_help_database_user: Database user with rights to create tables and read/write data.
setup_help_default_content_language: Primary language for content entries and fallbacks when translations are missing.
setup_help_default_system_language: Primary interface language used for menus, messages and administration.
setup_help_media_path: Relative path for storing uploaded media files. Must be writable by the server process. Example: ./mediaFolder
setup_help_site_name: Public facing name of your site. Appears in titles and navigation.
setup_help_system_languages: All interface languages users can switch the admin UI to. Include default plus any additional fully translated sets.
setup_note_add_codes_default_cannot_be_r: Add existing or custom codes. Default cannot be removed.
setup_review_intro: Please review your configuration before completing the setup. Once finished, you'll be redirected to the login page.
setup_system_intro: Configure the basic settings for your CMS including site name, language preferences, and media storage.
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_1: Go to MongoDB Atlas → Network Access
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_4: For production, use your specific IP address
setup_troubleshoot_atlas_ip_5: Changes may take 1-2 minutes to take effect
setup_troubleshoot_auth_1: Verify your username and password are correct
setup_troubleshoot_auth_2: Check if the user has proper database permissions
setup_troubleshoot_auth_3: Try connecting with admin credentials first
setup_troubleshoot_auth_4: For Atlas: Ensure IP whitelist includes your IP address
setup_troubleshoot_auth_5: For Atlas: Password may contain special characters that need encoding
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_1: Verify your cluster name is correct in the connection string
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_2: Check that your cluster is running (not paused)
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_3: Ensure you copied the full connection string from Atlas
setup_troubleshoot_cluster_4: Try pasting the full connection string into the Host field
setup_troubleshoot_creds_2: Enter your database username and password
setup_troubleshoot_creds_3: For local development, you may need to create a user first
setup_troubleshoot_creds_4: For Atlas: Copy the connection string with credentials from MongoDB Compass
setup_troubleshoot_dbnotfound_1: The specified database doesn't exist yet
setup_troubleshoot_dbnotfound_2: The database will be created automatically on first use
setup_troubleshoot_dbnotfound_3: Or create it manually in your database client
setup_troubleshoot_default_2: Verify the database server is accessible
setup_troubleshoot_default_3: Review the error message above for specific details
setup_troubleshoot_default_4: Check the application logs for more information
setup_troubleshoot_default_5: For Atlas: Try pasting the full connection string from MongoDB Compass
setup_troubleshoot_host_1: Check if the database server is running
setup_troubleshoot_host_2: Verify the host address and port are correct
setup_troubleshoot_host_4: For Docker: Use container name instead of localhost
setup_troubleshoot_host_5: For Atlas: Ensure you copied the correct cluster hostname
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_1: Connection timed out - server may be slow or unreachable
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_3: Verify the host and port are correct
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_4: The server may be under heavy load
setup_troubleshoot_timeout_5: For Atlas: Check if your cluster is paused
setup_troubleshoot_user_1: Go to MongoDB Atlas → Database Access
setup_troubleshoot_user_4: Grant "Read and write to any database" permission
setup_troubleshoot_user_5: Wait 1-2 minutes for the user to be created
welcome_modal_body: Let's get your CMS configured and ready to use. This quick setup wizard will guide you through connecting your database, creating an admin account, and configure basic system settings.
